quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Dead Sea and The Dead Sea
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, john, square. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the great fortification built in 37-31 BC by Roman king Herod I on a high hill above the Dead Sea?
Tiananmen Square, which has been the site of a number of political events and student protests, is located in what Chinese city?
The Rosenbergs, who were convicted of conspiracy, were held at what prison?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sing Sing

questions.question: Attica Prison was the locale of a 1975 riot that resulted in 38 deaths.
The Kremlin, a historic fortified complex at the heart of Moscow, overlooks this square to the east.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Square

questions.question: Nelsons Column, built to commemorate Admiral Horatio Nelsons death, is a monument in this famous London square.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trafalgar Square

questions.question: The Dead Sea is part of the Great Rift Valley. How far does this valley extend in length?
The Tower of London was built primarily to function as a fortress, a royal palace and a prison.
The Bible tells the story of a woman that was turned into a pillar of salt near the Dead Sea. Who was her famous husband?
What body of water feeds the Dead Sea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jordan River

questions.question: What famous California prison was home to Charles Manson?
The Dead Sea, the lowest point on Earth, is how far below sea level?
American politician John McCain was incarcerated at the infamous Hoa Loa Prison, ironically called Hanoi Hilton.
What is the average salinity of the Dead Sea?
No animals or plants live in the Dead Sea .

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Netherlands and City
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, crossroads. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the capital city of the Netherlands?
What city in Eastern Europe, often associated with the story of Dracula, is also famous for Revolution Square, which was the site of a 1989 revolt?
Which square is not correctly matched with the capital city in which it is located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Azadi Square - Karachi

questions.question: Rotterdam, located in the province of South Holland, is a major Dutch port.
The name “Holland” is equivalent to the name the Netherlands.
What former president has addressed more than a million people on many occasions on Plaza de la Revolución in Havana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fidel Castro

questions.question: Dutch is the official language of the Netherlands. What is the second official language of the country?
What two countries border the Netherlands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belgium and Germany

questions.question: Gouda and Edam are famous types of Dutch cheeses.
What are the three colours of the national flag of the Netherlands from top to bottom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red, white, and blue

questions.question: Grand Place, which is known for its large flower carpet, is the main square of this capital European city.
What famous square is located in Vatican City, the papal enclave within Rome?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Peters Square

questions.question: What is the name of the sea that borders the Netherlands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Sea

questions.question: What iconic world landmark, sometimes called the Crossroads of the World, was formerly named Longacre Square?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Times Square

questions.question: Piazza San Marco (St Marks Square), which Napoleon allegedly called The drawing room of Europe, is the principal square of this Italian city.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Island and Indonesia
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, sebatik, nations. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What island is shared by Indonesia and the nation of East Timor?
The tiny island of Märket / Märketin in the Baltic Sea is shared by these two nations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finland and Sweden

questions.question: What is the name of the island shared by Haiti and the Dominican Republic?
The word ‘ocean’ is of Greek origin.
This tiny Caribbean island is shared by France and the Netherlands.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Martin

questions.question: What South American island is shared by Chile and Argentina?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tierra Del Fuego

questions.question: Which is the smallest ocean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Arctic Ocean

questions.question: What Mediterranean island is divided between a Greek community and a Turkish community (although the latter is not internationally recognized as a separate entity)?
Demographically, the Netherlands matches which of this characteristics?

options.text: Its population is first in average height in the world.
It is one of most densely populated countries in the world.
It is one of the most densely cabled countries in the world.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The island of Sebatik, located east of Borneo, is shared by Indonesia and what other nation?
What portion of the Earth’s surface do oceans cover?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: More than two thirds

questions.question: The Marianas Trench, the deepest location on the surface of the Earths crust, lies in this ocean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pacific Ocean

questions.question: Which of these islands is shared by three countries?
What European island is partially occupied by a neighbouring island nation, which has led to centuries of dispute?
What island is shared by the nations of Indonesia and Papua New Guinea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Guinea

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Island and Artificial Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, bering, rokko. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which man-made island, located to the southwest of Singapore, was created by joining several natural islands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jurong Island

questions.question: The Mediterranean Sea is connected to the Atlantic Ocean by this strait.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Strait of Gibraltar

questions.question: What is the popular name of the artificial island in Tokyo Bay, whose name is Yume No Shima in Japanese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dream Island

questions.question: What is the name of the artificial island located in the Gatun Lake portion of the Panama Canal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barro Colorado Island

questions.question: What is the name of the Peruvian floating islands, located in Lake Titicaca?
The Pacific Ocean is the largest of the Earths oceanic divisions. Its name is derived from the Latin name Mare Pacificum which has the following meaning.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Peaceful Sea

questions.question: The famous Île Notre-Dame, an artificial island built from earth excavated for a metropolitan railway, is located in which country?
The Dead Sea is actually a lake.
This artificial island, whose name literally means Pepper Islet, is part of the Oresund Bridge, connecting Denmark with Sweden.
Which 20-kilometre artificial island, situated in the river Danube, was nicknamed the Copa Kagrana?
Which one of these Asian rivers does not flow into the Indian Ocean?
The Bering Sea is a part of which ocean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pacific Ocean

questions.question: What sea is known to be the only sea without shores?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sargasso Sea

questions.question: Rokko island, constructed between 1973 and 1992, is an artificial island situated in which country?
Which artificial island is situated in San Francisco Bay, between San Francisco and Oakland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Treasure Island

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, kind, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When did the euro become the official currency of the Eurozone?
The name of which US state means large creek in the Seneca language?
Which country was not among the founding states of the European Economic Community (the European Union predecessor)?
Which former Yugoslavian republic was the first to be admitted to the European Union?
Montgomery is the capital city of this US state, and its largest city is Birmingham.
Many countries held national referenda before joining the European Union. Which of the following nations showed the highest support for joining (92% in favour)?
When did Ireland join the European Union?
The citizens of which country rejected the idea of joining the EU in 1972 and again in 1994?
The history of EU began on 25th of March 1957 when the European Economic Community was formed. What is the founding act called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Treaty of Rome

questions.question: Spiral Island, a small Mexican artificial floating island, was situated on the coast of which sea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Caribbean Sea

questions.question: Everglades National Park is located in this US state.
The flag of which US state features a white American Bison on a blue field?
The EU has been a western club for most of its history. But which of these western countries has stayed out of the EU?
What kind of agreement is the Schengen Agreement?

options.text: It is a visionary chapter about a further EU enlargement.
It allows EU citizens to travel without passports within the EU borders.
It regulates the relationships with non-EU countries, especially Russia.
It introduced a common currency - the Euro.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It allows EU citizens to travel without passports within the EU borders.

questions.question: The 6th European Union enlargement took place on May 1 2004. How many countries were admitted then?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and Philippines
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, traders, theory. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to one theory, the name of this US state comes from the French word for hurricane.
What are the largest cities in the Philippines in terms of land area?

options.text: Davao City and Puerto Princesa City

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Davao City and Puerto Princesa City

questions.question: Who was the first  female  President of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corazon Aquino

questions.question: The name of this US state means great river and its symbol is the magnolia tree.
The Ifugao Rice Terraces are  located in Luzon, in the Philippines. If it were possible to place them end to  end, how long would they extend?
Which best  describes the religious distribution of the populace of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 82% Catholic, 9% Protestant, 5% Muslim and  3 % Buddhist

questions.question: Baton Rouge is the capital of what US state?
From 1888-1889, American traders Simon and Thomas Metcalfe brought some men from Manila to the Western Hemisphere. Which state did they bring them to?
The smallest monkey on earth is found in the Philippines.
Who is the first Filipino-American to become Governor of a US state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Cayetano

questions.question: Which US state has been nicknamed The First State, The Small Wonder, Blue Hen State, and The Diamond State?
The largest city in what US state hosts Summerfest, or The Worlds Largest Music Festival?
The Philippines has the worlds largest deposit of heavy water which can be used for atomic energy, in spectroscopy, and as an automobile fuel. What makes heavy water different from water?

options.text: One  less hydrogen molecule making it HO not H2O

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The presence of deuterium

questions.question: The state drink of this US state is milk, its state bird is the Western Meadowlark, its state flower is the Wild Prairie Rose, and its state slogan is Legendary.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Dakota

questions.question: On December 7, 1941 the Japanese launched a sneak attack on Pearl Harbor. On that day they also launched a similar attack on this American airbase in the Philippines.

options.text: Clark Air Force Base, Pampanga, Philippines

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Angeles, Pampanga, Philippines
